The government acted responsibly by strictly containing the virus to protect peopleâ€™s lives. It's acting responsibly now by facilitating travel&logistics. The key is to take a scientific look at the evolving situation, adapt to the changes, and make the tough yet right decision.
Travel and logistics will become smoother. Life and work will return to normal at a faster pace. Economic vitality will be freed up immensely.

With Omicron less likely to cause hospitalization and death, China is refining its COVID policy to better coordinate COVID response with economic and social development, paving the way for economic rebound.
6âƒ£ï¸China will resume outbound tourism for Chinese citizens in an orderly fashion, starting with a pilot scheme.

5âƒ£ï¸China will adjust the cargo-only policy at ports of entry and gradually resume entry and exit of passengers by land and water and provide greater convenience for Chinese and foreign crew change in China.

4âƒ£ï¸China will further refine arrangements for foreign nationalsâ€™ entry into China for such purposes as resumption of work, business, education, visiting relatives and family reunion and provide corresponding visa facilitation.

3âƒ£ï¸Passenger capacity limits on international flights will be removed with phased increases in the number of flights and refined distribution of flight routes. Airlines need to keep proper prevention measures in place on board including mandatory mask-wearing for passengers.

2âƒ£ï¸Nucleic acid tests will no longer be conducted on inbound travelers upon arrival. Those with no issues to report in their health declaration who have been given regular customs inspection and quarantine clearance can enter China without being subject to quarantine.

1âƒ£ï¸Inbound travelers need to show a negative nucleic acid test taken within 48 hours prior to departure. The test result will need to be noted in the customs health declaration form. Inbound travelers no longer need to apply for a health code from Chinese embassies/consulates.

We stand ready to work with the international community to defeat the virus, better protect lives and health of the people, and revitalize the world economy.
We believe that with the concerted efforts of the Chinese people, our economic and social undertakings will enter into a new stage of balanced and orderly growth.
In light of the changing Covid situation, China is refining its policy to better coordinate Covid response with economic and social development.

It has also gained precious time to know more about the virus scientifically, conduct R&D of vaccines and therapeutics, and increase vaccination. All in all, the policy has helped us achieve the best result with the minimum cost.
Facts have proved that China's Covid response policy in the past three years has protected lives and health of our people to the maximum extent possible.

China, as a member of the Asia-Pacific, has benefited much from the region and shared its development gains with others in the region in return.
China will strive to safeguard world peace and development as it pursues its own development, and it will make greater contributions to world peace and development through its own development.
China will continue its efforts to achieve common prosperity for all, and provide more resources for global development cooperation.

The modernization of China, a country with over 1.4 billion people, will be of epoch-making importance in human history. China will continue to take the people-centered approach, with a goal of increasing its middle-income population to more than 800 million in the next 15 years.
It is important to pursue higher-level opening up, strive for higher-standard connectivity, and build stable and unimpeded industrial and supply chains.
Efforts should be made to forge a new partnership of unity and equality, a partnership that is balanced and inclusive.

It is important to follow a people-centered development approach. More should be done to ensure peopleâ€™s wellbeing through economic development. The developed economies in the Asia-Pacific should play a positive role and actively support the developing economies.
It is important to pursue the vision of common, comprehensive, cooperative and sustainable security, and jointly reject the Cold War mentality and bloc confrontation.
Facing these new developments, it is important to draw on past experience and lessons and respond to the challenges of the times, so as to build an Asia-Pacific community with a shared future.
We need to follow a path of solidarity. It is important to strengthen cooperation, support and help each other, and enable the Asia-Pacific to be a leader in boosting global economic recovery.

We need to follow a path of openness and inclusiveness. Any attempt to disrupt or even dismantle the industrial and supply chains formed in the Asia-Pacific over many years will only lead Asia-Pacific economic cooperation to a dead end.

We need to follow a path of peaceful development. The Asia-Pacific is no oneâ€™s backyard and should not become an arena for big power contest. No attempt to wage a new cold war will ever be allowed by the people or by the times.
The world has once again reached a crossroads. Where is it headed? What should the Asia-Pacific do? These questions demand urgent answers.

A China marching toward modernization will bring more opportunities to the world and inject stronger momentum for international cooperation.
Unilateral sanctions must be removed, and restrictions on relevant scientific and technological cooperation must be lifted.

The way out of this is to develop an open, stable and sustainable commodities market, and work together to unclog supply chains and stabilize market prices. We must resolutely oppose the attempt to politicize food and energy issues or use them as tools and weapons.
On food and energy security, the root cause of the ongoing crises is not production or demand, but interrupted supply chains and international cooperation.

It is therefore more imperative than ever for us to focus on the issue of development, and send a positive message of the G20â€™s commitment to supporting the growth of developing countries and preventing divergent and unbalanced global recovery.
We should make global development more resilient. The world economy is at risk of recession. Everyone is having a hard time, but developing countries are bearing the brunt.

China has established the Global Development and South-South Cooperation Fund, and will increase its funding for the China-UN Peace and Development Fund. We are working with 100-plus countries and international organizations on the #GlobalDevelopmentInitiative.

Modernization is not a privilege reserved for any single country. Frontrunners in development should sincerely help others develop&provide more global public goods. All major countries should perform their due responsibilities&do their best for the cause of global development.

We should make global development more inclusive and elevate our win-win cooperation to a new height. We should make global development beneficial to all. Prosperity and stability cannot be possible in a world where the rich become richer while the poor are made poorer.

China has all along stood on the side of peace and will continue to encourage peace talks. We support a resumption of peace talks between Russia and Ukraine. At the same time, we hope that the United States, NATO and the EU will conduct comprehensive dialogues with Russia.

On the Ukraine crisis, it is important to give serious thought to the following: first, conflicts and wars produce no winner; second, there is no simple solution to a complex issue; and third, confrontation between major countries must be avoided.
The two sides need to respect each other, pursue mutual benefit, focus on the larger picture, and nurture a sound atmosphere and stable relations for cooperation.

It is in our mutual interest to benefit from each otherâ€™s development. It is also in our mutual interest to promote post-COVID global recovery, tackle climate change and resolve regional issues through China-U.S. coordination and cooperation.

It is in the mutual and fundamental interest of China and the United States to prevent conflict and confrontation and achieve peaceful coexistence. The two economies are deeply integrated, and both face new tasks in development.
The Chinese nation has the proud tradition of standing up for itself. Suppression and containment will only strengthen the will and boost the morale of the Chinese people.

There is always competition in the world, but competition should be about learning from each other to become oneâ€™s better self and make progress together, not about taking others down in a zero-sum game.

Neither side should try to remold the other in oneâ€™s own image, or seek to change or even subvert the otherâ€™s system. Instead of talking in one way and acting in another, the United States needs to honor its commitments with concrete action.

While the United States practices capitalism, China practices socialism. The two countries take different paths. Such difference is nothing new and will continue to exist. For China and the United States to get along, it is vital to recognize and respect such difference.

The specific differences between 2 sides can be worked out through discussion, but only on the precondition of equality. The so-called â€œdemocracy versus authoritarianismâ€ narrative is not the defining feature of todayâ€™s world, still less does it represent the trend of the times.

Just as the United States has American-style democracy, China has Chinese-style democracy; both fit their respective national conditions. No country has a perfect democratic system, and there is always a need for development and improvement.
We hope that the U.S. side will match its words with action and abide by the one-China policy and the provisions of the three joint communiquÃ©s.

We hope to see, and are all along committed to, peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait, but cross-Strait peace and stability and â€œTaiwan independenceâ€ are as irreconcilable as water and fire.

The Taiwan question is at the very core of Chinaâ€™s core interests, the bedrock of the political foundation of China-U.S. relations, and the first red line that must not be crossed in China-U.S. relations.
indeed, it is the most important guardrail and safety net for China-U.S. relations.

Observing the basic norms of international relations and the three Sino-U.S. joint communiquÃ©s is vitally important for the two sides to manage differences and disagreements and prevent confrontation and conflict;

The two sides should respect each other, coexist in peace, pursue win-win cooperation, and work together to ensure that China-U.S. relations move forward on the right course without losing direction or speed, still less having a collision.
China does not seek to change the existing international order or interfere in the internal affairs of the United States, and has no intention to challenge or displace the United States.
China-U.S. interactions should be defined by dialogue and win-win cooperation, not confrontation and zero-sum competition.

The world is big enough for the two countries to develop themselves and prosper together. The two sides should form a correct perception of each otherâ€™s domestic and foreign policies and strategic intentions.

China-U.S. relations should not be a zero-sum game where one side out-competes or thrives at the expense of the other. The successes of China and the United States are opportunities, not challenges, for each other.

President Xi pointed out that the world is at a major inflection point in history. Countries need to both tackle unprecedented challenges and seize unprecedented opportunities. This is the larger context in which we should view and handle China-U.S. relations.

China will stay committed to peaceful development, open development and win-win development, participate in and contribute to global development, and pursue common development with countries across the world.

China pursues an independent foreign policy of peace, always decides its position and attitude based on the merits of issues, and advocates resolving disputes peacefully through dialogue and consultation. China is committed to deepening and expanding global partnerships.

The policies of the CPC are open and transparent, with clearly stated and transparent strategic intentions and great continuity and stability. We base our efforts on the goal of meeting peopleâ€™s aspirations for a better life, and unswervingly pursue reform and opening up.

https://t.co/JmW5wVGUVb
We welcome you to visit more places in our country and present to the world the unbiased and truthful stories of China, of the CPC and of the new era we are living in.

Over the past week, our media friends have covered the #20thCPCNationalCongress extensively. With your help, China's voice and the CPC's views have been heard across the globe and the world has turned its eyes to China. Thank you for your hard work and a job well done!
We will be steadfast in deepening reform and opening up across the board and in pursuing high-quality development. A prosperous China will create many more opportunities for the world.

Just as China cannot develop in isolation from the world, the world needs China for its development. Through over 40 years of relentless reform and opening up, we have created the twin miracles of fast economic growth and long-term social stability.

We will work with all other peoples to champion humanityâ€™ s common values of peace, development, equity, justice, democracy and freedom, to promote global peace and prosperity, and to keep pursuing a shared future for the human community.
When all countries pursue the cause of common good, we can live in harmony, engage in cooperation for mutual benefit and join hands to create a brighter future for the world.

We shall always champion the common values of humanity. The world is grappling with unprecedented challenges. We have consistently called on the people of the world to grasp and shape the future and destiny of humanity.

We must make sure that our century-old Party, the biggest in the world, will become ever more vigorous through self-reform, and continue to be the strong backbone that the Chinese people can lean on at all times.
We must remain on high alert and stay sober-minded and prudent like a student sitting for a never-ending exam. We must not halt our steps in exercising full and rigorous intra-Party governance.
It can only become invincible if it remains committed to self-reform even though it has had a glorious past.

We shall always press ahead with self-imposed reform. A political party can only achieve lasting greatness if it remains committed to its original aspiration despite the many hardships it has gone through.

We will always ride out the storm with our people and stay heart to heart with them. Taking their priorities as ours and acting on their wishes, we will continue the hard work to turn their aspiration for a better life into a living reality.

The journey ahead is long and arduous, but with determined steps we will reach our destination. We will not be daunted by high winds, choppy waters or even dangerous storms, for the people will always have our back and give us confidence.

We shall always act for the people and rely on them in everything we do. To date, we have secured one tremendous achievement after another by relying closely on our people. In the future, we will continue to rely on them in creating new historic achievements.

We shall always keep an enterprising spirit. The CPC and our people have sought long and hard to open a Chinese path to modernization. This is a great yet enormous undertaking. The enormity of the task is what makes it great and infinitely glorious.

We shall keep in mind the Partyâ€™s nature and purpose and our mission and responsibility and work diligently in the performance of our duty to prove worthy of the great trust of the Party and our people.
On behalf of the CPCâ€™s new central leadership, I wish to thank the whole Party sincerely for the trust you have placed in us.

Just as the US will not allow Hawaii to be split away, China has the right to uphold the unification of the country as Taiwan is part of China. Recently the US has repeatedly referred to the â€œstatus quo in the Taiwan Straitâ€, and even accused China of â€œchanging the status quoâ€.
Recognizing and adhering to one-China is also the political prerequisite for all the 181 countries in establishing diplomatic ties with China.
Over the past five decades, the UN has always referred to Taiwan as â€œTaiwan, Province of Chinaâ€: this is Taiwanâ€™s only status in international law.
As things stand, the Taiwan question is growing into the biggest risk in China-US relations. Should it be mishandled, it is most likely to devastate our bilateral ties.

Wang stressed that the Taiwan question is at the heart of Chinaâ€™s core interests; the one-China principle is the cornerstone of the political foundation for China-US relations; the three China-US Joint CommuniquÃ©s are the most crucial â€œguardrailsâ€ for our relations.

For cooperation to be win-win, there needs to be necessary conditions and atmosphere. It wonâ€™t do if the US undermines Chinaâ€™s core interests and the foundation for bilateral cooperation on the one hand, and on the other, expects China to cooperate unconditionally.
We need healthy competition that brings out the best in each other, not vicious competition that aims at each otherâ€™s demise.

At the same time, competition should have boundaries and, more importantly, be fair play. It should be conducted in compliance with widely recognized rules, and not be fixated on undercutting the development capability of others and denying them the legitimate rights & interests.

Undeniably, China and the US have competition in areas like economy&trade, and China does not fear such competition. However, we do not agree that China-US relations should be simply defined by competition, because this is not the entirety or the mainstream of this relationship.

No cooperation can be based on a win-lose format. Win-win cooperation is not only possible, but also a must. This is the true narrative of China-US relations in the past half a century, and it should remain the goal we both pursue.

â€¦rather than imposing oneâ€™s domestic law on the other. At the international level, they should be the basic norms governing international relations based on the purposes and principles of the UN Charter.

For China and the US to coexist in peace, we must follow the rules that both sides subscribe to. Bilaterally, they should be the three China-US Joint CommuniquÃ©s and the important common understandings reached between leaders of the two countries,...

China is committed to not seeking hegemony, expansion, coercion or sphere of influence, and it wants to live in peace with all other countries. This is undoubtedly a big contribution to global strategic stability.
The CPC, Chinaâ€™s governing party, has incorporated peaceful development into its constitution, and China is the only major country that has codified peaceful development in the Constitution.

For 70-plus years since the founding of the Peopleâ€™s Republic, China has never provoked a conflict, occupied one inch of foreign soil, started a proxy war, or joined any military bloc. China has the best peace record among the worldâ€™s major countries.

China respects the development path chosen by the American people. We welcome an open and confident US that enjoys growth and progress. The US should also respect Chinese peopleâ€™s choice of development path.
Defining oneâ€™s own choice as democratic and the otherâ€™s as authoritarian, and seeing success as changing the other side in oneâ€™s own image are neither consistent with the facts, nor realistic.

We now can see clearly that China will not become another US, and the US cannot mould China to its liking. Neither side is able to take the other down. This means we need to respect each otherâ€™s choices.

Should the US handle its relations with China with a zero-sum mindset and continue to let â€œpolitical correctnessâ€ misguide its China policy, it wonâ€™t find solutions to its own problems, but lead China-US relations to conflict and confrontation.
Mr. Joseph Nye compared the relations to a sleepwalking syndrome that could stumble into a new Cold War.

Such deviations are dangerous and come at a high price. Mr. Kevin Rudd described the current China-US relations as in a workshop with exposed wires and cables lying everywhere, water on the floor and sparks flying.

What is the crux of the matter? It boils down to how the US perceives China, the world and itself. Be it full confrontation or strategic competition, both have deviated from the right course of China-US relations.
This is self-contradictory in both logic and reality.

The US has, on the one hand, made repeated provocations on issues involving Chinaâ€™s core interests and development rights and interests, yet on the other, expressed a desire to keep the bilateral ties stable and prevent conflict and confrontation.
â€¦and extending the list of Chinese companies under its sanctions to over 1,000 entities and individuals?

â€¦by repeated official exchanges and arms sales including many offensive weapons, and is advancing the deliberation of the â€œTaiwan Policy Actâ€ that threatens the very foundation of China-US relations underpinned by the three Joint CommuniquÃ©s?

How will the US honor its important statement of not supporting â€œTaiwan independenceâ€ when it has, regardless of Chinaâ€™s strong opposition, allowed its House Speaker to visit Taiwan again after 25 years, kept elevating substantive relations with Taiwanâ€¦
â€¦pressed other countries to pick sides and formed various small circles that exclude China?

How can a new Cold War be prevented, when the US has, identifying China as the primary rival and the most serious long-term challenge, engaged in all-round containment, sought to encircle China by shaping the strategic environment around it,â€¦
â€¦and takes aim at Chinaâ€™s political system, development path and governing party?

How will the US deliver on its promise of not aiming to change Chinaâ€™s system, when it has framed a false narrative of â€œdemocracy versus authoritarianismâ€, a narrative that deliberately amplifies an ideological confrontation with Chinaâ€¦

And the bilateral relationship isâ€‚beingâ€‚defined and impacted dangerously by so-called strategic competition. This is bringing tremendous uncertainty to the future of our peoples and to countries across the world.

to keep its business environment free, open, and regulated, to maintain the common law, and to expand and facilitate its exchanges with the world.

4. We must maintain Hong Kong's distinctive status and strengths. The central government fully supports Hong Kong in its effort to maintain its distinctive status and advantages, to consolidate its position as an international financial, shipping, and trading hub,

3. We must ensure that Hong Kong is administered by patriots. It is a universal political rule that a government must be in the hands of patriots. There is no country or region in the world where people will allow an unpatriotic or even treasonous force or figure to take power.
Only when the enforcement of the central government's overall jurisdiction dovetails with the fulfillment of a high degree of autonomy in the SARs, can the SARs be well governed.
2. We must uphold the central government's overall jurisdiction while securing the SARs' high degree of autonomy.

With this as the prerequisite, Hong Kong and Macao can keep the previous capitalist systems unchanged for a long time and enjoy a high degree of autonomy. All residents in the special administrative regions should conscientiously respect & uphold the country's fundamental system.

1. We must fully and faithfully implement the policy of "one country, two systems." This policy embodies a complete system. Its top priority is to safeguard national sovereignty, security, and development interests.

Only if we have a profound and accurate understanding of the laws guiding the practice of "one country, two systems," can we make sure our cause advances in the right direction in a sound and sustained manner.

It has won firm support from the 1.4 billion-plus Chinese people including the residents of Hong Kong and Macao. It is also widely accepted by the international community. There is no reason for us to change such a good policy, and we must adhere to it in the long run.
"One country, two systems" has stood repeated tests in practice. It serves the fundamental interests of not only Hong Kong and Macao, but also the whole country and the nation.

First, the central government stays resolute in implementing the policy, and will not change or vacillate in this stand; and second, this policy is to be implemented fully and precisely as what it is originally intended.

All that the central government has done are for the benefit of Hong Kong&Macao, the wellbeing of all residents of the two regions, and the future of the whole country. The central government, in implementing the policy of "one country, two systems", follows two key principles:

"One country, two systems" is an unprecedented innovation. Its fundamental purpose is to safeguard China's sovereignty, security, and development interests and to maintain long-term prosperity and stability in Hong Kong and Macao.

The democratic system of HKSAR conforms to both the "one country, two systems" policy and the region's constitutional status. It is in the interest of Hong Kong residents' democratic rights and the region's prosperity and stability, securing a bright future for the region.
With the principles of the Hong Kong people administering Hong Kong and a high degree of autonomy in practice, the region has truly entered an era of democracy.

Throughout history, people in Hong Kong have always maintained a close bond and stood with the motherland through thick and thin. Over the past 25 years, the success of "one country, two systems" in Hong Kong has won recognition throughout the world.

I warmly welcome you to invest and do business in China, strengthen business cooperation with China, and share in Chinaâ€™s development opportunities.
China will continue to pursue opening-up against higher standardsï¼Œand continue to foster a market- and law-based and internationalized business environment.
We will step up macroeconomic policy adjustment, and adopt more forceful measures to deliver the economic and social development goals for the whole year.
This will ensure that all countries enjoy equal rights, follow the rules as equals, and share equal opportunities.
We should promote extensive consultation and joint contribution to deliver shared benefits, and increase the representation and say of emerging markets and developing countries.
Anyone who attempts to turn back the wheel of history and block othersâ€™ way will only have his own path blocked.
There is widespread concern in the international community that should such a tendency continue, the global economy will become compartmentalized and mutually exclusive.
We should be inclusive and jointly expand openness and integration. For some time, however, economic globalization has faced headwinds and countercurrents.

To politicize the global economy & turn it into oneâ€™s tool or weapon, and willfully impose sanctions by using oneâ€™s primary position in the intl financial&monetary systems will only end up hurting oneâ€™s own interests as well as those of others, and inflict suffering on everyone.
It has been proved time and again that sanctions are a boomerang and a double-edged sword.

People have reason to be concerned that the world economy might slip into a crisis. At this critical juncture, tiding over difficulties together and pursuing cooperation is the only way for us to forestall an economic crisis.

We should tide over difficulties together and jointly pursue win-win cooperation. At present, some important industrial and supply chains are suffering from deliberate disruptions, and global economic recovery is losing steam.

We should reach out to each other and jointly promote sustainable global development. We should respond to peopleâ€™s concerns, pursue the larger interests of all countries, and steer global development to a new era to deliver benefit to all.
We in the international community should be clear we are a community in which all countries share a common stake, and we should see that the light of peace will reach all corners of the world.
Only when we all cherish and uphold peace and never forget the painful lessons of war can there be hope of peace.
Blind faith in the so-called â€œposition of strengthâ€ and attempts to expand military alliances and seek oneâ€™s own security at the expense of others will only land oneself in a security dilemma.

We should embrace solidarity and coordination and jointly maintain world peace and stability. The tragedies of the past tell us that hegemony, group politics and bloc confrontation bring no peace or security; they only lead to wars and conflicts.
We should rise to challenge and forge ahead with resolve toward the goal of building a community with a shared future for mankind.

We should stand high and not allow ourselves to be distracted by fleeting clouds, and we should have a keen appreciation of the law governing the advance of history. We should refuse to be led astray by any turn of events or intimidated by any risk.
And our shared desire to meet challenges together through cooperation will remain as strong as ever.

Human history, like a river, keeps surging forward, with moments of both calm waters and huge waves. Despite changes in an evolving global environment, the historical trend of openness and development will not reverse course.

President Xi noted global development has suffered major setbacks. Where is the world headed: Peace or war? Progress or regression? Openness or isolation? Cooperation or confrontation? These are choices of the times that we are confronted with.

4âƒ£ï¸Stepping up Global Human Rights Governance.
The promotion and protection of human rights is a common cause for humanity and thus requires the concerted efforts of all. When it comes to human rights issues, there is no such thing as a flawless utopia...
More efforts are needed to achieve development of higher quality, efficiency, equity, sustainability and security, so as to provide strong safeguards for the advancement of human rights.

3âƒ£ï¸Following a Holistic Approach to all Categories of Human Rights.
Human rights are a rich and all-encompassing concept, and must be advanced with systematic measures. For developing countries, the rights to subsistence and development are the primary human rights.
Should that happen, it is the people who will bear the brunt. There is no shortage of such examples, and lessons must be learned.
Any system or model blindly copied from another country regardless of the situation on the ground will not only look out of place, but also bring disastrous consequences.

2âƒ£ï¸Respecting Different Countries' Paths of Human Rights Development. 
Countries should and can only explore suitable paths of human rights development in light of national realities and people's needs.

The most important criterion for assessing a country's human rights conditions is whether its people enjoy a growing sense of fulfillment, happiness & security. The people should become the main participants, contributors & beneficiaries of human rights development.

It is important to make continuous efforts to address the most pressing and immediate issues that concern the people the most, and strive to deliver a better life to the people. That is the biggest human right.

It is most important to work on the following four priorities: 
1âƒ£ï¸Putting People Front and Center.

Countries, no matter their size and strength, and both in and outside the region, should all add splendor rather than trouble to Asia. All should follow the path of peace and development, seek win-win cooperation, and contribute to an Asian family of unity and progress together.
... this is the only choice worthy of the broad-mindedness of Asians.

We should jointly promote Asian unity. Choosing dialogue and cooperation over zero-sum games, openness and inclusiveness over a closed-door and exclusive approach, and exchanges and mutual learning over a sense of superiority: ...
... follow a policy of good-neighborliness and friendship, and make sure that we always keep our future in our own hands.

The Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence and the Bandung Spirit, first advocated by Asia, are all the more relevant today. We should honor such principles as mutual respect, equality, mutual benefit and peaceful coexistence ...

We should resolutely safeguard peace in Asia. Peace and stability in our region does not fall into our lap automatically or come as charity from any country. Rather, it is the result of the joint efforts of countries in the region.

We need to continue developing and strengthening Asia, demonstrate Asiaâ€™s resilience, wisdom and strength, and make Asia an anchor for world peace, a powerhouse for global growth and a new pacesetter for international cooperation.
Over the past decades, Asia has enjoyed overall stability and sustained rapid growth, making possible the Asian Miracle. When Asia fares well, the whole world benefits.
Having been through hot and cold wars, hardships and tribulations, people in Asia deeply cherish the value of peace and understand that development gains do not come easily.
It is particularly important for major countries to lead by example in honoring equality, cooperation, good faith and the rule of law, and act in a way befitting their status.

In todayâ€™s world, unilateralism and excessive pursuit of self-interest are doomed to fail; so are the practices of decoupling, supply disruption and maximum pressure; so are the attempts to forge â€œsmall circlesâ€ or to stoke conflict and confrontation along ideological lines.
Acts to remove any single part will cause serious problems to its operation. When that happens, both the victims and the initiators of such acts will stand to lose.
In this day and age, the international community has evolved so much that it has become a sophisticated and integrated apparatus.

stay committed to peacefully resolving differences and disputes between countries through dialogue and consultation; stay committed to maintaining security in both traditional and non-traditional domains.

ğŸ”—https://t.co/ivCXxDo6u4 https://t.co/WeyklitEBS

Leaders of both sides agreed that this has been a candid and in-depth discussion in which the two sides increased mutual understanding and reached common understandings in many areas. They agreed to step up communication and exchanges and keep up coordination and cooperation.

President Xi stressed that #China and the #EU should offset uncertainties in the international landscape with the stability of China-EU relations, deepen economic globalization through open cooperation and meet global challenges through solidarity and collaboration.
President Xi stressed that #China and the #EU should act as two major forces upholding world peace, two big markets promoting shared development, and two great civilizations promoting human progress.

The more critical the situation, the greater the need to stay levelheaded. China & the EU need to commit themselves to keeping the situation under control, preventing spillover of the crisis, and, most importantly, keeping the system, rules&foundation of the world economy stable.

Many are worried that the current situation may wipe out the fruits of international economic cooperation gained through decades of efforts. Should the situation continue to worsen, it may take years, if not decades, to get things back on track.

We must not allow attempts to politicize and weaponize the world economy or use it as a tool to serve oneâ€™s own agenda, as such attempts will trigger serious crises in global finance, trade, energy, technology, food, industrial and supply chains, among others.

Fourth, preventing the regional conflict from magnifying. One should not focus on just one aspect of the issue without regard to the rest, or take the entire world as a hostage, still less make ordinary people around the world suffer as a result.
#China supports the #EU in playing a primary role, and supports dialogue among Europe, #Russia, the #US and #NATO for a balanced, effective and sustainable security framework in Europe.

Third, fostering lasting peace in Europe&the Eurasian continent. The root cause of the Ukraine crisis is the regional security tensions in Europe that have built up over the years. A fundamental solution is to accommodate the legitimate security concerns of all relevant parties.
China will stay in touch with the #EU to jointly forestall a bigger humanitarian crisis.

Second, preventing a humanitarian crisis on a bigger scale. #China has provided multiple batches of emergency humanitarian assistance to #Ukraine, and sent supplies to European countries receiving large numbers of refugees.
The international community should keep creating favorable conditions and environment for the negotiations between #Russia and #Ukraine, rather than add fuel to the fire and aggravate tensions.
#China supports the #EUâ€™s efforts toward a political settlement of the #Ukraine issue, and has been encouraging peace talks in its own way.
Under the current circumstances, it is important to do the following: First, promoting peace talks. Peace talks are the only viable way to prevent an escalation of tensions.

President Xi emphasized that #China finds it deeply regrettable that the situation in #Ukraine has come to where it is today. China always stands on the side of peace and draws its conclusion independently based on the merits of each matter.

Noting the consistency and continuity of Chinaâ€™s #EU policy, President Xi called on the EU to form its own perception of #China, adopt an independent China policy, and work with China for the steady and sustained growth of China-EU relations.

President Xi underscored the need for #China and the #EU to increase communication on their relations and on major issues concerning global peace and development, and play a constructive role in adding stabilizing factors to a turbulent world.

President Xi recalled his visit to the #EU headquarters eight years ago when he proposed a #China-#EU partnership for peace, growth, reform and civilization. This vision remains unchanged. If anything, it has become more relevant under the current circumstances.

As we have seen in the field of play, even the strongest contenders can compete peacefully and cheer for one another, because their goal is not to beat others but to surpass themselves. The same spirit should also ring true when it comes to relations between states.

The Games not only brings warmth and hope to people of all countries who are caught in the chilly winter of the #pandemic, but also injects the much-needed strength of peace and unity into this volatile world.
The success of #Beijing2022 is an accomplishment for #China, and even more so for the world.
The two sides need to respect each otherâ€™s core interests and adhere to non-interference in internal affairs.
and view the #China-#Europe relationship from a strategic and long-term perspective to ensure the overall direction of a healthy relationship.

At the same time, we hope that #Europe could move forward from the â€œpartner-competitor-rivalâ€ characterization of its relations with #China, focus on dialogue and cooperation, stick to mutual benefit,Â·Â·Â·
#China will continue to support European integration, support an #EU with greater unity and prosperity, and support European strategic autonomy.
#China and #Europe can and must provide more stability and positive energy for the world.
To make the world a better place, #China and #Europe must play its part.
The idea of exclusive security and absolute security must be rejected. We all must guard against and oppose any attempt forâ€œnew #ColdWarâ€ .

We need to work together to safeguard global peace and tranquility. Security of a country should not come at the expense of that of another country. And security of a region cannot be realized by beefing up military blocs.

We need to work together to promote balanced and robust recovery of the world economy. What is urgently needed is further #openness and integration, not isolation and #decoupling, and to remove trade barriers, bring down â€œexclusive yards with high wallsâ€.

We need to work together to champion and act on true #multilateralism. No country, not even a super power, should replace international norms with its own will, still less put itself above international norms.

State-to-state relations should not be simplistically defined by competition only. And no country should be obsessed with turning back the wheel of history and repeat past mistakes of forging rivaling alliances.
To make the world a better place, countries must work in sync.

#China, with higher quality development and better capability to deliver, will provide stronger impetus for global recovery beyond #COVID and greater contribution to international peace and stability.
Facts have proved that #Chinaâ€™s development has increased certainty in the world and expanded the force for peace.

#China has all along honored its international responsibilities and obligations with real actions. China has so far provided over 2.1 billion doses of #vaccines to more than 120 countries and international organizations, making China the biggest provider of #COVID vaccines.

We expect major countries to take the lead in supporting #multilateralism, living up to their international commitments, acting on the purposes of the #UNCharter, and contributing to world peace and development.
To make the world a better place, major countries must lead by example.

Only when countries row the oars together and cheer up each other, rather than undercut and come after one another, can we overcome the current challenges and sail into a bright future. In this process, the role and action of major countries are critically important.
Indeed our world faces once again the danger of division and confrontation. So what shall we do? The answer lies in greater solidarity and cooperation under the banner of #multilateralism.

We should never grow the economy at the cost of resource depletion and environmental degradation, which is like draining a pond to get fish; nor should we sacrifice growth to protect the environment, which is like climbing a tree to catch fish.

#China will stay committed to reform and opening-up.
China will stay committed to promoting ecological conservation.
As a rising tide lifts all boats, everyone will get a fair share from development, and development gains will benefit all our people in a more substantial and equitable way.

#China will stay committed to pursuing high-quality development. The common prosperity we desire is not egalitarianism. To use an analogy, we will first make the pie bigger, and then divide it properly through reasonable institutional arrangements.
Different countries and civilizations may prosper together on the basis of respect for each other, and seek common ground and win-win outcomes by setting aside differences.

... to hold back economic and technological advances of other countries, and of fanning ideological antagonism and politicizing or weaponizing economic, scientific and technological issues, will gravely undercut international efforts to tackle common challenges.

Acts of single-mindedly building â€œexclusive yards with high wallsâ€ or â€œparallel systemsâ€, of enthusiastically putting together exclusive small circles or blocs that polarize the world, of overstretching the concept of national security...

Even worse are the practices of hegemony and bullying, which run counter to the tide of history. Naturally, countries have divergences and disagreements between them. Yet a zero-sum approach that enlarges oneâ€™s own gain at the expense of others will not help.

History has proved time and again that confrontation does not solve problems; it only invites catastrophic consequences. Protectionism and unilateralism can protect no one; they ultimately hurt the interests of others as well as oneâ€™s own.

Our world today is far from being tranquil; rhetorics that stoke hatred and prejudice abound. Acts of containment, suppression or confrontation arising thereof do all harm, not the least good, to world peace and security.

No matter what difficulties may come our way, we must adhere to a people-centered philosophy of development, place development and livelihoods front and center in global macro-policies, and make sure that no country is left behind.
Some developing countries have fallen back into poverty and instability due to the pandemic. Many in developed countries are also living through a hard time.
The process of global development is suffering from severe disruption. The Human Development Index has declined for the first time in 30 years.
We should remove barriers, not erect walls. We should open up, not close off. We should seek integration, not decoupling. This is the way to build an open world economy.
Despite the countercurrents and dangerous shoals along the way, economic #globalization has never and will not veer off course. Countries around the world should uphold true #multilateralism.

Economic globalization is the trend of the times. Though countercurrents are sure to exist in a river, none could stop it from flowing to the sea. Driving forces bolster the riverâ€™s momentum, and resistance may yet enhance its flow.
Still, #China will provide another one billion doses to #African countries, including 600 million doses as donation, and will also donate 150 million doses to #ASEAN countries.

Strong confidence and cooperation represent the only right way to defeat the pandemic. #China has already sent over two billion doses of #vaccines to more than 120 countries and international organizations.

Amidst the raging torrents of a global crisis, countries are not riding separately in some 190 small boats, but are rather all in a giant ship on which our shared destiny hinges. Small boats may not survive a storm, but a giant ship is strong enough to brave a storm.
We need to learn from comparing long history cycles, and see the change in things through the subtle and minute. We need to pool great strength to go through difficulties and challenges.
We need to move forward by following the logic of historical progress, and develop by riding the tide of development of our times.

The world is always developing through the movement of contradictions; without contradiction, nothing would exist. The history of humanity is a history of achieving growth by meeting various tests and of developing by overcoming various crises.
How to beat the pandemic and how to build the post-#COVID world? These are major issues of common concern to people around the world. They are also major, urgent questions we must give answers to.
The world today is undergoing major changes unseen in a century. These changes represent the profound and sweeping changes of our times.
We must do everything necessary to clear the shadow of the pandemic and boost economic and social recovery and development, so that the sunshine of hope may light up the future of humanity.
To meet the severe challenges facing humanity, we must â€œadd wings to the tigerâ€ and act with the courage and strength of the tiger to overcome all obstacles on our way forward.
